Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
Level Description: Advanced (complete and accurate representation of all elements)
CAN: The student can accurately draw two distinct habitats, one terrestrial and one aquatic, with detailed features such as trees, bushes, water bodies, and grass.
The student can illustrate a wide variety of living organisms specific to each habitat, such as birds and squirrels in the forest, and fish and lily pads in a pond.

The student can observe and depict patterns clearly, showing the differences in plant and animal life between the land and water habitats (e.g., noting that fish are underwater and birds are in the trees).
The student can effectively organize and label the drawing to indicate clear observations of the living things in each habitat, potentially using text labels or a key for clarity.
CANNOT: There might still be minor omissions or inconsistencies, such as forgetting to label one or two elements, but these do not significantly detract from the overall understanding.
